$DATUM Synthesis of Ir(NC)(NNtBu)(C6H5)OTf (2-Ph): In a Schlenck bomb complex
2-CH3 (100mg,0.1168mmol), was heated at 170°C in benzene (30ml) for 6.5h.
The solvent was then removed under reduced pressure. The resulting yellow
microcrystalline solid was redissolved in minimal amount of CH2Cl2 and
reprecipitated with pentane, yielding 103.9mg (96.9%) of 2-Ph. Synthesis
of Ir(NC)(NNtBu)(C6H5)OTf (2-Ph):, yield 103.9mg (96.9%). Anal. Calcd for
2-Ph: C 53.64, H 4.39, N 6.10, F 6.21. Found: C 53.30, H 4.31, N 6.03, F
6.33. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 400MHz) 9.18 (d, 1H, 3J = 5.9, H-1), 8.89 (d, 1H, 3J
= 6.1, H-24), 8.40 (d, 1H, 3J = 8.1, H-4), 8.13 (d, 1H, 4J = 2.0, H-21),
8.07 (d, 1H, 4J = 1.8, H-18), 8.04 (d, 2H, 3J = 7.3, H-12), 7.82(dt, 1H,
3J = 7.8 4J = 1.4, H- 3), 7.61 (d, 1H, 3J = 5.9, H-15), 7.46 – 7.32 (m,
5H, H-2, 13, 14, 23), 7.27 (dd, 1H, 3J = 5.9 4J = 1.8, H- 16), 7.17 (d,
1H, 3J = 8.2, H-8), 7.11-6.60(bs, 5H, Ir-Phenyl), 6.86 (bt, 1H, 3J = 7.0,
Ir-Phenyl), 6.53 (d, 1H, 3J = 8.1, H-9), 1.50 (s, 9H, -C(CH3)3), 1.35 (s,
9H, -C(CH3)3). 13C NMR (CDCl3, 100.62MHz) 164.17, 162.67, 162.55, 161.90,
159.06, 156.14, 152.80, 149.82, 149.08, 148.17, 139.41, 138.97, 137.60,
137.51, 135.45, 128.64, 128.28, 128.03, 126.45, 125.72, 124.56, 124.25,
124.18, 122.39, 121.14, 120.86(q, CF3, J = 318.6), 120.66, 119.31,
118.88, 30.38(-C(CH3)3), 30.26(-C(CH3)3), 35.43(- C(CH3)3),
35.36(-C(CH3)3). 19F NMR (CDCl3, 376.51MHz) –78.97.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reactions of alcohols 1-7, 16: The alcohol (1
mmol) is dissolved in 1mL of C6H6 and 3 mL of CF3SO3H is added. After at
least 2 hrs of stirring, the mixture is poured over ice, and the solution
is made basic with 10 M NaOH. Extraction with CHCl3 is followed by
aqueous washes of H2O (1x) and brine (2x), and then drying with anhydrous
Na2SO4. The product is then purified by chromatography (hexane : EtOAc)
or recrystallization. 2-(1,2,2-Triphenyl-ethyl)-pyridine (11). White
solid mp: 167-170°C 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ, ppm: 4.81(s,2H),
7.06-7.23(m,17H), 8.39(broad, 2H). 13C NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ, ppm: 55.8,
55.9, 124.0, 126.2, 126.4, 126.6, 128.32, 128.38, 128.40,128.48, 128.50,
128.55, 141.7, 142.6, 149.6, 152.6. Low resolution MS (EI), m/z: 335
(M+), 167, 165, 152.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective

$DATUM dmPheboxIr(OAc)(C6D5) (2a-d5). A resealable Teflon-capped NMR tube was
charged with 1a (5.3 mg, 0.0084 mmol) and 0.43 mL C6D6 were vacuum
transferred to give a light green solution. Dioxane (0.8 μL, 0.0084 mmol)
was added via microsyringe and the solution was degassed using three
freeze/pump/thaw cycles. The mixture was heated at 100 °C for 2 h,
resulting in a bright orange solution. Yield: 96%, determined by
integration of Phebox-aryl-H signal against dioxane internal standard.
dmPheboxIr(OAc)(C6D5) (2a-d5), yield 96%. 1H NMR (C6D6, 500 MHz, 25 °C):
δ 6.58 (s, 1H, Phebox-aryl-H), 3.68 (d, 2H, JHH' = 8.3 Hz, OCH2), 3.57
(d, 2H, JHH' = 8.3 Hz, OCH2), 2.68 (s, 6H, Phebox-CH3), 2.08 (br s, 3H,
OAc), 1.56 (br s, 3H, HOAc), 1.24 (s, 6H, CH3), 0.95 (s, 6H, CH3). 1H NMR
(C6D6, 500 MHz, 40 °C): δ 6.58 (s, 1H, Phebox-aryl-H), 3.68 (d, 2H, JHH'
= 8.3 Hz, OCH2), 3.57 (d, 2H, JHH' = 8.3 Hz, OCH2), 2.68 (s, 6H,
Phebox-CH3), 1.79 (br s, 6H, OAc/HOAc), 1.24 (s, 6H, CH3), 0.96 (s, 6H,
CH3).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Preparation of β -Benzoylacrylic acid A 500 mL flask equipped with a
magnetic stirring bar, thermometer and condenser was charged with maleic
anhydride (24.5 g, 0.25 mole) and 150 mL of benzene. To the mixture was
added portion wise (72 g, 0.54 mole) of aluminum chloride at room
temperature. The mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 30 minutes. Then the
content of the flask was poured onto 300 mL of ice-water and 75 mL of
concentrated hydrochloric acid was added to the mixture. The solution was
extracted with 2 X 350 mL of ethyl acetate. The organic layer was dried
over 20 g of anhydrous magnesium sulfate and filtered. The filtrate was
concentrated under reduced pressure to give 42 g of β -benzoylacrylic
acid in 95.5% yield as yellow solid. β -Benzoylacrylic acid , yield 95.5%
1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 7.97-8.03 (m, 3H), 7.61-7.64 (m, 1H), 7.50-7.55 (m, 2H),
6.89 (d, J= 15.83 Hz, 1H). 13C NMR(CDCl3)δ 189.9,166.6,137.4,
136.8,133.1,132.7, 128.6,128.3.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Process for the production of lisinopril
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Ridvanoglu, Nurten

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Photostimulated reaction of iodobenzene 1a:
The reaction was carried out in a 20 mL flame-dried Schlenk tube,
equipped with a nitrogen inlet and magnetic stirrer at room temperature.
DMSO (13 equiv., 0.5 mL) was dried and deoxygenated, then benzene (2)
(150 equiv., 6.7 mL), t-BuOK (3.0 equiv., 0.168 g, 1.5 mmol) and
substrate 1a (1.0 equiv, 0.102 g, 0.5 mmol) were added and the reaction
mixture was irradiated for 1 h. The reaction was quenched with water and
ammonium nitrate in excess. The residue was extracted with ethyl acetate
(4 x 20 mL) and the organic extract was washed with water, dried with
anhydrous Na2SO4 and filtered. The solvent was removed to leave the crude
product. The product 3a was purified by radial thin-layer chromatography
on silica gel eluting with petroleum ether and was isolated.
3-Phenylpyridine (3q) as a yellowish oil, yield 96%. 1H NMR (400 MHz,
CDCl3, TMS) δ 8.85 (d, J = 1.8 Hz, 1H, CH), 8.58 (dd, J = 4.8, 1.3 Hz,
1H, CH), 7.88 - 7.85 (m, 1H, CH), 7.59 - 7.57 (m, 2H, CH), 7.49 - 7.45
(m, 2H, CH), 7.42 - 7.38 (m, 1H, CH), 7.35 (dd, J = 7.9, 4.8 Hz, 1H, CH).
13C NMR (101 MHz, CDCl3) δ 148.5 (CH), 148.4 (CH), 137.9 (C), 136.7 (C),
134.5 (CH), 129.2 (CH), 128.2 (CH), 127.2 (CH), 123.6 (CH). 1H-1H COSY
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δH/δH8.85/7.87, 8.58/7.87, 8.58/7.35, 7.87/7.35,
7.58/7.47, 7.58/7.40, 7.47/7.40. 1H-13C HSQC NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3)
δH/δC8.85/148.4, 8.58/148.5, 7.87/134.5, 7.58/127.2, 7.47/129.2,
7.40/128.2, 7.35/123.6 1H-13C HMBC NMR δH/δC8.85/148.5, 8.85/136.7,
8.85/134.5, 8.85/123.6, 8.58/148.4, 8.58/136.7, 8.58/134.5, 8.58/123.6,
7.87/148.5, 7.87/137.9, 7.58/136.7, 7.58/128.2, 7.58/127.2, 7.47/137.9,
7.47/129.2, 7.40/137.9, 7.40/127.2, 7.35/148.5, 7.35/136.7. GC-MS (70eV):
m/z (%): 156 (13) [M+ + 1], 155 (100) [M+], 128 (12), 127 (19), 102 (13),
51 (12).

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
Condensed Products 10-19. A 0.2 g portion of the acetyl-substituted
heteroarene was dissolved in 1.0 mL of C6H6, and to this solution was
added 5.0 mL of triflic acid. This mixture was stirred at room
temperature (6 was reacted at 50 °C) for 4-12h and then poured over
several grams of ice. The resulting solution was made basic with
concentrated NaOH and extractedwith CHCl3. The organic phase was washed
with H2O and brine and then dried with MgSO4. Removal of the solvent
under reduced pressure then provided the product. The product (s) was
then purified by recrystallization or column chromatography.
4-(1,1-Diphenylethyl)pyridine, yield 96%. mp 87-90 °C (CHCl3);1H NMR δ
2.17 (s, 3H), 7.02-7.10 (m, 6H), 7.25-7.31 (m, 6H), 8.50 (d, J = 6.0 Hz,
1H); 13C NMR δ 29.7, 52.3, 123.8, 126.4, 128.1, 128.5, 147.2, 149.5,
157.9; EI MS 259 (M+); HRMS m/z calcd for C19H17N 259.1361, found
259.1358.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Electrophilic activation of acetyl-substituted heteroaromatic compounds
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Klumpp, Douglas A.; Garza, Manuel; Sanchez, Gregorio V. Jr.; Lau, Siufu;
de Leon, Sarah
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2000), 65(26), 8997-9000

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Alkylation of benzene with
1-(adamantan-1-yl)-1,2,3,6-tetrahydropyridines 2a-e (General method).
Trifluoromethanesulfonic acid (10 ml, 11.3 mmol) was added portionwise
with stirring to a solution of 1,2,3,6-tetrahydropyridine 2a-e (5 mmol)
in benzene (10 ml), while cooling the reaction mixture on an ice bath.
After stirring for 30 h at 25°C, the reaction mixture was poured on ice,
adjusted with 30% NaOH to pH 10-11, and extracted with dichloromethane
(3×15 ml). The combined organic extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4
and evaporated at reduced pressure. The products 4a-c were purified by
recrystallization from a 15:1 mixture of hexane and ethyl acetate.
1-(Adamantan-1-yl)-4ax-methyl-4eq-phenylpiperidine (4b). Yield 1.48 g
(96%), colorless crystals. mp 98-100°C. IR spectrum, v, cm-1: 3394, 2912
(C-H Ad), 2846 (C-H Ad), 1600, 1496, 1446, 1315, 1122, 1076, 960, 821,
763, 702, 547. 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm (J, Hz): 1.20 (3H, s, 4ax-CH3);
1.54-1.66 (6H, m, 3CH2 Ad); 1.70 (6H, s, 3CH2 Ad); 1.76-1.82 (2H, m,
3,5-CHax); 2.05 (3H, br. s, 3CH Ad); 2.11-2.17 (2H, m, 3,5-CHeq);
2.56-2.64 (2H, m, 2,6-CHeq); 2.70-2.75 (2H, m, 2,6-CHax); 7.13-7.18 (1H,
m, H-4 Ph); 7.27-7.36 (4H, m, H-2,3,5,6 Ph). 13C NMR spectrum, δ, ppm:
29.7 (4ax-CH3); 29.8 (CH Ad); 36.4 (C-4); 37.0 (CH2 Ad); 37.9 (3,5-CH2);
38.5 (CH2 Ad); 40.8 (2,6-CH2); 54.5 (C Ad); 125.5 (C-4 Ph); 125.9 (C-2,6
Ph); 128.3 (C-3,5 Ph); 149.4 (C-1 Ph). Mass spectrum, m/z (I rel, %): 309
[M]+ (100), 253 (84), 215 (12), 135 [Ad]+ (42), 79 (14). Found, %: C
85.46; H 10.04; N 4.59. C22H31N. Calculated, %: C 85.38; H 10.10; N 4.53.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General method B, for preparation of
heterocyclic alcohols (9-13): The N-heterocyclic alcohol (1 mmol) is
dissolved in 3 ml C6H6; CF3SO3H (3ml, 33mmol) is added slowly with
stirring. The reaction mixture stirred for overnight at 60°C and then the
reaction mixture poured on ice. More CHCl3 (ca. 30 ml) is then added and
the aqueous layer is mare basic with 10M NaOH. Separation of the organic
phase is followed by washings with water, and then twice with saturated
brine. The organic solution is dried with MgSO4, filtered, and
concentrated with rotary evaporator. If necessary, the product may be
further purified by silica gel chromatography (hexane: ethyl acetate).
2,2'-(biphenyl-4-ylmethylene)dipyridine (9).
2-(biphenyl-4-yl(1-butyl-1H-imidazol-2-yl)methyl)pyridine (13). Using
general method B, compound 13 is isolated as a light brown oil (Rf 0.21,
2:1 hexanes: ethyl acetate): 1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 0.83 (t, J=7.3 Hz,
3H), 1.24 (m, 2H), 1.56 (m, 2H), 3.83 (t, J=6.6 Hz, 2H), 5.78 (s, 1H),
6.91 (d, J=1.2 Hz, 1H), 7.1 (d, J=1.2 Hz, 1H), 7.15-7.19 (m, 1H),
7.33-7.45 (m, 6H), 7.59-7.54 (m, 4H), 7.64 (td, J=7.8, 1.8Hz, 1H), 8.57
(m, 1H); 13C NMR: δ 13.6, 19.8, 32.8, 45.9, 51.8, 119.6, 122.0, 123.9,
127.0, 127.2, 127.4, 127.8, 128.7, 129.2, 136.8, 139.2, 140.0, 140.7,
147.2, 149.1, 160.9. Low resolution MS (EI): 367 (M+), 338, 310, 243,
167, 158. High resolution MS (EI), calculated for C25H25N3 367.20485,
found 367.20368.

$DATUM Synthesis of 3b. To a stirred yellow toluene solution (10 mL) of 2b
(0.601 g, 0.782 mmol) was added trimethylsilane chloride (0.845 g, 7.82
mmol) dropwise. The solution was stirred overnight. An orange precipitate
gradually formed. The reaction mixture was taken to dryness to obtain an
orange powder, which was collected on a frit, washed with pentane (3 x 2
mL), and dried. X-ray-quality orange crystals of 3b were grown by the
slow evaporation of a benzene solution of the compound. Yield 0.563 g,
0.751 mmol, 96%. 1H NMR (C6D6, 300 MHz): δ 7.63 (dd, 2H, JHP = 6 Hz, JHH
= 6 Hz, o- PPh), 7.197.14 (m, overlap with the solvent peak), 7.08 (m,
3H), 3,68 (sept, 2H, 6 Hz, CH), 3.44 (sept, 2H, 6 Hz, CH), 2.60 (m, 2H),
2.49 (m, 2H), 2.14 (m, 2H), 1.78 (m, 4H), 1.64 (m, 2H), 1.53 (d, 6H, 6
Hz, CH3), 1.42 (d, 6H, 6 Hz, CH3), 1.19 (d, 6H, 6 Hz, CH3), 1.09 (d, 6H,
6 Hz, CH3). 31P{1H} NMR (C6D6, 121 MHz): δ -32.3 (s). 13C{1H} NMR (C6D6,
101 MHz): δ 172.3 (d, 48 Hz), 146.3, 145.0, 141.9, 131.2 (d, 16 Hz),
129.9, 128.9 (d, 13 Hz), 128.0, 127.7, 124.9, 124.4, 102.4 (d, 50 Hz),
34.1 (d, 17 Hz), 31.0 (d, 4 Hz), 29.0, 28.5, 25.7, 25.6, 24.4, 24.3 (d, 8
Hz), 24.0. EI-MS (m/z): 752 ([M]+). Anal. Calcd for C40H51 Cl2N2PZr: C,
63.81; H, 6.83; N, 3.72. Found: C, 63.54; H, 6.63; N, 3.72.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Example 3 (D100016-140). Inside a glove box, a 100 mL round-bottom flask
equipped with a reflux condenser, stirring bar, and gas inlet was charged
with 2,5-dibromo-benzene-sulfonyl chloride (15.05 g, 45 mmoles), benzene
(15 mL), and anhydrous nitromethane (45 mL). Aluminum chloride (6.67 g,
50 mmoles) was added and the mixture stirred until dissolved. The
solution was heated to 100°C overnight. The solution was cooled to room
temperature and poured onto 100 g ice mixed with 50 mL hydrochloric acid.
The mixture was extracted twice with dichloromethane. The organic
extracts were washed twice with water, dried with sodium carbonate,
filtered, and evaporated to give 16.28 g (96%). The sol ids were
recrystall ized from ethanol after treating with decolorizing carbon.
13.48 g (80% yield) of 2,5-dibromo-diphenylsulfone. 1H NMR (DMSO-d6):
7.65 (ddd, 8.4, 7.4, 2.0 Hz, 2H), 7.76 (tt, 7.4, 1.2 Hz, 1H), 7.76 (d,
8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.85 (dd, 8.4, 2.4 Hz, 1H), 7.98 (ddd, 8.4, 2.0 1.2 Hz, 2H),
8.40 (d, 2.4 Hz, 1H).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM alternative reaction conditions gave lower yield
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Method of making sulfo-containing polyarylene and membranes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Teasley, Mark F.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2011082167 A1 2011-07-07

$DATUM Example 3 (D100016-140) Inside a glove box, a 100 mL round-bottom flask
equipped with a reflux condenser, stirring bar, and gas inlet was charged
with 2,5-dibromo-benzene-sulfonyl chloride (15.05 g, 45 mmoles), benzene

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES

$DATUM 96
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1295-35-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1333-74-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedures for Synthesis of
[(η6-arene)Ni(N-heterocyclic carbene)] (ANC) Complexes. Note: Employing
weldried and -degassed solvents is essential to generate ANCs
quantitatively. Commercially available dehydrated solvents may cause a
decrease of purity of the products. A reaction tube was charged with
Ni(cod)2 (2.0 mmol), NHC (2.0 mmol), and solvent (20 mL). The resulting
solution was transferred into an autoclave reactor, and then H2 was
pressurized quickly (recommended within 5 min) into the reactor at 5-8
atm. After the reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature overnight
(~16 h), the resultant brown solution was filtered, and all volatiles
were removed under reduced pressure to give [(η6-arene)Ni(NHC)] (ANC) as
a reddish brown solid. Synthesis of (η6-benzene)Ni(IPr) (BNI). The
general procedure was followed with Ni(cod)2 (551 mg, 2.00 mmol), IPr
(779 mg, 2.00 mmol), and benzene (20 mL), and the reaction was conducted
at room temperature for 16 h to give BNI (1.01 g, 1.92 mmol, 96%) as a
reddish brown solid. 1H NMR (400 MHz, C6D12; Figure S1a, Supporting
Information): δ 7.29 (t, J = 7.6 Hz, 2H, Ar-H), 7.16 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 4H,
Ar-H), 6.59 (s, 2H, NC2H2N), 5.22 (s, 6H, η6-C6H5), 2.84-2.77 (m, 4H,
CH(CH3)2), 1.30 (d, J = 6.8 Hz, 12 Hz, CH(CH3)2), 1.07 (d, J = 6.8 Hz,
12H, CH(CH3)2). 13C{1H} NMR (100 MHz, C6D12; Figure S1b, Supporting
Information): δ 195.9, 147.1, 139.6, 128.8, 123.6, 119.6, 89.1 (η6-C6H5),
29.2, 24.7, 23.7. Anal. Calcd for C33H42N2Ni: C, 75.44; H, 8.06; N, 5.33.
Found: C, 75.25; H, 8.17; N, 5.90.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM benzene also used as solvent, autoclave used, alternative preparation
shown
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM One-pot, single-step, and gram-scale synthesis of mononuclear
[(η6-arene)Ni(N-heterocyclic carbene)] complexes: useful precursors of
the Ni0-NHC unit
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Hoshimoto, Yoichi; Hayashi, Yukari; Suzuki, Haruka; Ohashi, Masato;
Ogoshi, Sensuke
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organometallics (2014), 33(5), 1276-1282

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME295 STEP1
$RXN



  2  1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Example 2: Preparation of diphenyl(4-methyl
phenyl)sulfonium triflate Both 1 g of phenyl sulfoxide and 0.51 g of
toluene dissolved in 50 mL dichloromethane was stirred and then, 1.48 g
of triflic anhydride was slowly added to the mixture. The reacting
mixture was stirred at the same temperature for 30 minutes, and the
reaction temperature was slowly increased up to room temperature. Then,
the reacting mixture was washed with distilled water. After the complete
removal of organic solvent contained in the washed organic layer under
vacuum drying, an oil phase with larger viscosity was obtained. The oil
phase, so formed, was completely dissolved in dichloromethane and with a
slow addition of ether, a white precipitate was obtained. The precipitate
was filtered, and dried by vaccum oven, Example 3: Preparation of
triphenylsulfonium triflate In the procedure as described in Example 2,
the sulfonium salt was prepared except that instead of using 0.51 g of
toluene, 0.43 g of benzene was employed, 1.89 g of triphenylsulfonium
trilflate (yield: 96%). The formula was shown in the table 1. M.p
101-102°C
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Procedure for the CF3SO3H-Catalyzed Reactions. In a 50mL glass pressure
tube (with Teflon screw cap), ~100 mg of the pyrazine derivative is
dissolved in 2mL benzene, and 5mL triflic acid is then slowly added. The
sealed tube is then heated to 80°C. After 4h, tube is cooled and the
product mixture is poured onto ice. The resulting solution is neutralized
by 10.0 M NaOH solution, and extracted twice with CHCl3. The organic
phase is washed with brine and then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. After
concentration, the products are then purified by flash column
chromatography (etehr:hexane). 2-Phenethyl-pyrazine2 (2a). Yellow oil. 1H
NMR 500 MHz, CDCl3, δ: 3.06-3.11 (m, 2H), 3.11-3.16 (m, 2H), 7.16-7.23
(m, 3H), 7.25-7.31 (m, 2H), 8.37 (s, 1H), 8.40 (d, 1H, J = 2.0 Hz), 8.52
(s, 1H). 13C NMR 125 MHz, CDCl3, δ: 35.4, 37.2, 126.2, 128.4, 128.5,
140.8, 142.4, 144.1, 144.7, 156.7, 13C DEPT (45) NMR: 35.4, 37.2, 126.2,
128.4, 128.5, 142.4, 144.1, 144.7, 156.7. 13C DEPT (90) NMR: 126.2,
128.4, 128.5, 142.4, 144.1, 144.7, 156.7. 13C DEPT (135) NMR: 35.4
(neg.), 37.2 (neg.), 126.2, 128.4, 128.5, 142.4, 144.1, 144.7, 156.7. Low
resolution mass spectrum (EI) m/z: 184 (M+), 183, 91.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 2-Benzyl-4-bromobenzonitrile (10). 4-Bromo-2-(bromomethyl)benzonitrile
(9, 3.25 g, 11.82 mmol) was added under N2 to AlCl3 (3.14 g, 23.6 mmol)
in anhydrous benzene (30 mL) at 0 °C. The reaction mixture was allowed to
warm to room temperature and heated at reflux (45 min). The reaction was
allowed to cool, poured onto ice (50.0 g), and made acidic to pH 2 with
5% HCl. The suspension was extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 × 75 mL) and the
combined extracts were washed with water and brine, dried (MgSO4), and
concentrated under reduced pressure to provide a white solid. The white
solid was recrystallized from toluene/ petroleum ether to provide 10
(3.10 g, 96%) as white crystals; Compound 10 was used without further
characterization in the preparation of 11. mp 73-75 °C. 1H NMR (CDCl3): δ
4.13 (s, 2H, Ar-CH2-Ar), 7.07-7.50 (brm, 8H, Ar-H). 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ
40.56, 127.63, 129.49, 129.55, 130.88, 133.82, 134.55.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Reaction of Quinoline and Isoquinoline Aldehydes with Arenes; General
Procedure. The heterocyclic aldehyde (0.2 g) was dissolved in benzene (1
mL) or the corresponding arene (1 mL, for 19 and 20) and CF3SO3H (2 mL)
and the mixture was stirred at r.t. for 3 h. The mixture was then poured
over ice and the resulting solution was made basic by slow addition of aq
50% NaOH solution. The products were then extracted into CHCl3, the
organic phase was washed with H2O then brine, dried (MgSO4), and the
product was isolated by removal of solvent from under vacuum.
2-(Diphenylmethyl)quinoline, yield 96%. Mp 105-107 °C. 1H NMR
(CDCl3/TMS): δ = 5.91 (s, 1 H), 7.20-7.31 (m, 12 H) 7.49 (m, 1 H), 7.67
(m, 1 H), 7.75 (d, 1 H, J = 7.8 Hz), 8.14 (m, 1 H). 13C NMR (CDCl3/TMS):
δ = 60.2, 122.0, 126.3, 126.7, 126.9, 127.5, 128.5, 129.4, 129.5, 132.9,
136.4, 142.7, 148.0, 162.3. EI-MS: m/z = 295 (M+). Anal. calcd for
C22H17N: C, 89.46, H, 5.80. Found: C, 88.72, H, 5.89.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM The superacid induced condensation of quinolinecarboxaldehydes with
arenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Klumpp, Douglas A.; Jones, Andre; Lau, Siufu; De Leon, Sarah; Garza,
Manuel
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2000), (8), 1117-1120

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Preparation of (β-Diketiminate)copper(I) Benzene Adduct (2b). In a
glovebox, mesitylcopper(I) (434 mg, 2.36 mmol) and 1 (1.40 g, 2.22 mmol)
were added to a Schlenk flask equipped with a magnetic stirbar. On a
vacuum line, benzene (anhydrous, 15 mL) was added. After 4 hours, the
solvent was removed under reduced pressure and the solid was washed with
cold hexanes (2x5 mL) to give 2b as a yellow powder (1.64 g, 96%). 1H NMR
(C6D6, 300 MHz): δ 7.56 (s, 2H), 7.08 (s, 4H), 5.89 (s, 1H). 19F NMR
(C6D6, 282.7 MHz): δ -60.32 (6F), -62.26 (12F). 13C NMR (C6D6, 125.8 MHz)
δ 152.8 (q, J = 25.9 Hz), 150.9 (s), 128.9 (s), 128.7 (s), 124.5 (s),
124.1 (q, J = 273.1 Hz), 120.9 (q, J = 286.2 Hz), 118.4 (m), 85.25 (m).
UV-Vis (CH2Cl2) [λmax, nm (ε, M-1 cm-1)]: 379 (26,900). Anal. Calcd for
C48H20Cu2F36N4: C, 39.39; H, 1.38. Found: C, 39.13; H, 1.18.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM product is formed from an intermediate mononuclear complex
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Copper(I) Complexes of a Heavily Fluorinated β-Diketiminate Ligand:
Synthesis, Electronic Properties, and Intramolecular Aerobic
Hydroxylation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Laitar, David S.; Mathison, Casey J. N.; Davis, William M.; Sadighi,
Joseph P.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Inorganic Chemistry (2003), 42(23), 7354-7356

$DATUM 7664-93-9

$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 71-43-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of trans-1b by Scheme 3.
3-(3',4'-Dichlorophenyl)-3-phenylpropanoic Acid (10). A mixture of 3,4-
dichlorocinnamic acid (14; 95% trans, 50 g, 0.23 mol), benzene (150 mL),
and concentrated H2SO4 (100 mL) was stirred at 85-95 °C in a three-neck
round-bottom flask. When the level of 14 was ≤1%, the reaction mixture
was cooled to room temperature and slowly poured onto ice. The mixture
was stirred for 30 min and then transferred into a separatory funnel. The
aqueous layer was drained and extracted twice with EtOAc. The organic
solutions were combined and washed five times with water and twice with
brine. The solvent was then evaporated under reduced pressure and the
residue dried under high vacuum at room temperature for 24 h. The desired
acid 10 (65.8 g, 96% yield) was obtained as a thick oil. 1H NMR (DMSO-d6)
δ 12.23 (s, 1H), 7.66 (d, 1H, J = 2 Hz), 7.54 (d, 1H, J = 9 Hz),
7.40-7.13 (m, 6H), 4.49 (t, 1H, J = 9 Hz), 3.18-3.00 (m, 2H); IR (KBr)
3500-2200, 1718 cm-1.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Slow-onset, long-duration 3-(3',4'-dichlorophenyl)-1-indanamine monoamine
reuptake blockers as potential medications to treat cocaine abuse
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Froimowitz, Mark; Wu, Kuo-Ming; Moussa, Adel; Haidar, Reem M.; Jurayj,
Jurjus; George, Clifford; Gardner, Eliot L.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Medicinal Chemistry (2000), 43(26), 4981-4992

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: III. Experimental Procedure for the Oxidative
Amination with Various Nitrogen Sources: To a 5 mL screw-capped vial
equipped with a 15 x 10 mm spinvane triangular-shaped Teflon stirbar,
were added imide (0.3 mmol, 1 equiv), PhI(OAc)2 (483 mg, 1.5 mmol, 5
equiv) and benzene (1.5 mL). The resulting mixture was sealed with a
Teflon-lined cap and stirred at 140 °C for 4 h in an oil bath with
vigorous stirring. The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature,
filtered through a plug of silica and washed with EtOAc (30 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated, and evaporated to dryness under high vacuum.
The desired product was purified by flash column chromatography using
indicated eluents. N-Phenylphthalimide (Table 2, 3d), light yellow solid,
yield 96%. m.p. 199-201 °C; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3)δ 7.95-7.93 (m, 2H),
7.78-7.76 (m, 2H), 7.51-7.47 (m, 2H), 7.44-7.39 (m, 3H); 13C NMR (100
MHz, CDCl3)δ 167.2, 134.4, 131.7, 131.6, 129.1, 128.1, 126.5, 123.7; IR
(Film) 3031, 1733, 1700, 1505, 1454, 1387, 1111, 1069 cm-1; HRMS (FAB)
m/z calcd. For C14H9NO2 [M]+: 223.0633, found: 223.0636.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM chemoselective, alternative reaction conditions shown, alternative
reaction conditions gave lower yield, sealed vial used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Intermolecular Oxidative C-N Bond Formation under Metal-Free Conditions:
Control of Chemoselectivity between Aryl sp2 and Benzylic sp3 C-H Bond
Imidation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kim, Hyun Jin; Kim, Jiyu; Cho, Seung Hwan; Chang, Sukbok
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133(41), 16382-16385

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Diphenyliodonium-2-carboxylic acid (205): Potassium persulfate (5.2 g,
19.2 mmol) was added to a solution of o-iodobenzoic acid (4 g, 16.1 mmol)
in concentrated sulphuric acid (16 mL) at 0 degC. Benzene (4 mL, 45.2
mmol) was added after 30 min. The reaction mixture was stirred for 18 hr
at room temperature. The reaction mixture was poured on ice, adjusted to
pH 10 with aqueous NaOH solution (2 M) and extracted with chloroform.
Concentration of the chloroform extracts gave 5.0 g (15.4 mmol, 96 %) of
the iodonium carboxylate 205 as a colorless solid.

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Aryl 5-arylisoxazol-3-yl ketones XI-XIV
(general procedure). A mixture of 10 mmol of acid chloride XV or XVI, 12
mmol of anhydrous AlCl3, and 200 mmol of anhydrous benzene or toluene was
stirred for 30 min at 20°C and for 3 h at 80°C. The mixture was then
diluted with 100 ml of chloroform, treated with 10 ml of water,
thoroughly stirred, and poured into water acidified to pH 3-4. The
organic phase was separated, washed with water, a dilute solution of
potassium carbonate, and water again, and dried over calcium chloride.
The solvent was distilled off under reduced pressure, and the solid
residue was recrystallized from chloroform-hexane (1 : 2).
[5-(4-Methylphenyl)-1,2-oxazol-3-yl]phenyl-methanone (XIII). Yield 96%.
mp 120-121°C. IR spectrum, ν, cm-1: 1661 (C═O), 1610, 1595, 1578, 1566,
1506, 1452, 1445, 1431 (C═C, C═N). 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm: 2.38 s (3H,
CH3), 6.97 s (1H, 4-H), 7.26 d (2H, Harom, 3J = 7.8 Hz), 7.52 d.d (2H,
Harom, 3J = 7.6 Hz), 7.63 d.d (1H, Harom, 3J = 7.6 Hz), 7.71 d (2H,
Harom, 3J = 7.8 Hz), 8.35 d (2H, Harom, 3J = 7.6 Hz). 13C NMR spectrum,
δC, ppm: 21.56 (CH3), 99.69 (C4), 125.94 (2C, CHarom), 128.60 (2C,
CHarom), 129.86 (2C, CHarom), 130.75 (2C, CHarom), 134.04 (CHarom);
124.02, 135.82, 141.13, 162.43, 170.95 (Cquat); 185.80 (C═O). Found, %: C
77.47; H 5.10; N 5.30. m/z 263 [M]+. C17H13NO2. Calculated, %: C 77.55; H
4.98; N 5.32. M 263.31.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Step 1: l-Chloro-2-nitro-4-(phenylsulfonyl)benzene. Aluminum chloride
(15.64 g, 117.3 mmol) was added to a solution of
4-chloro-3-nitro-benzenesulfonyl chloride (25.02 g, 97.7 mmol) in 75 mL
of benzene and the reaction stirred under nitrogen at room temperature
for 16 h and then refluxed for 2 h. After cooling to room temperature 2 N
HCl (75 mL) was added dropwise. The mixture was partitioned between 2 N
HCI and ethyl acetate. The emulsion that formed was separated by the
addition of saturated NaC!. The organic layer was separated, extracted
one time with water, one time with saturated NaCl, dried (anhydrous
MgSO4), filtered and the solvent removed under reduced pressure to give
l-chloro-2-nitro-4-(phenylsulfonyl)benzene (27.84 g, 96%) as a brown
solid, MS (El) m/z 296.9; HRMS: calcd for C12H8ClNO4S, 296.98626; found
(EI, M+.), 296.9849.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

related protein-1 and their preparation, pharmaceutical compositions and
use in the treatment of disease

$DATUM 126757-08-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the condensation
reaction of aldehydes/ dicarboxaldehydes with aromatics, using BF3-H2O as
the acid catalyst Aldehydes or dicarboxaldehydes (1mmol) and neat
aromatics (2 mL for liquid aromatics; 4 eqv. for solid aromatics) were
taken in a sealed pressure tube. To this mixture, BF3-H2O (50 eqv., 4.2
g) was added and the mixture was stirred and heated at the required
temperature under closed condition till the reaction is completed.
Completion of the reaction was monitored by TLC and GCMS. The reaction
mixture was then poured into ice-water (10 mL) and extracted with
dichloromethane (3x 20 mL). Combined organic layer was washed with aq.
NaHCO3 solution, then with brine solution, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4
and then solvent was removed under reduced pressure to get the crude
product. The crude product was further purified by column chromatography
over silicagel (65-250 mesh) using hexane-ethyl acetate 2-10% as eluent.
Products were characterized and identified by analyzing their spectral
data (1H, 13C, 19F NMR data, GCMS and HRMS).
1-(Diphenylmethyl)-4-bromobenzene (7e) 1H NMR δ 5.44 (s, 1H), 6.92 (d, J
= 8.24 Hz, 2H), 7.04 (d, J = 7.32 Hz, 4H), 7.13-7.16 (m, 2H), 7.19-7.28
(m, 4H), 7.32 (d, J = 7.50 Hz, 2H); 13C NMR δ 56.1, 120.2, 126.4, 128.4,
129.3, 131.1, 131.3, 142.9, 143.2; MS (EI), m/z 322.8 (M·+), 241.7
(M·+-Br), 164.5 (M·+-Br-Ph).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM pressure tube used, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM BF3-H2O Catalyzed Hydroxyalkylation of Aromatics with Aromatic Aldehydes
and Dicarboxaldehydes: Efficient Synthesis of Triarylmethanes,
Diarylmethylbenzaldehydes, and Anthracene Derivatives
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Prakash, G. K. Surya; Panja, Chiradeep; Shakhmin, Anton; Shah, Eric;
Mathew, Thomas; Olah, George A.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2009), 74(22), 8659-8668

$DATUM Synthesis of complex II. A mixture of triphenylbismuth (0.43 g) and
3,4,5-trifluorobenzoic acid (0.35 g) in 20 ml of benzene was stored in a
sealed tube containing air oxygen for 16 h at 20°C. Crystals II, yield
0.60 g (95%). mp 218°C. IR (ν, cm-1): 1540 vs, 1420 s, 1240 w, 1180 w,
1040 s, 990 m; Formula: C68H28Bi4O18F24; Anal. calcd.: C, 33.66%; H,
1.16%; Found: C, 33.05%; H, 1.37%; M: 2424.82; Crystal system:
Monoclinic; T 173(1)K; Space group: P21/c; Unit cell parameters: a
10.0417(8)Å , b 24.134(2)Å , c 14.608(1)Å , β 101.777(2) deg; V:
3465.8(5)Å 3; Z: 2.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Ethyl
3-(4-Chlorophenylthio)-2,2-difluoro-3-phenylpropanoate (4aa). Under N2
atmosphere, SnCl4 (195 mg, 0.75 mmol) was added at room temperature to a
mixture of 3a (149 mg, 0.50 mmol) and benzene (1 mL). After stirring at
room temperature for 15 h, the mixture was poured into water (10 mL),
neutralized with aq NaHCO3, and extracted with Et2O (20 mL x 3). The
combined organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and concentrated under
reduced pressure. Purification by column chromatography (silica
gel/hexane-EtOAc) gave 4aa (164 mg) in 92% yield
3-(4-Chlorophenylthio)-2,2-difluoro-1,3-diphenylpropan-1-one (4b). The
reaction was performed as above using 3b (165 mg, 0.50 mmol), benzene (2
mL), and SnCl4 (195 mg, 0.75 mmol) at room temperature for 15 h.
Purification by column chromatography (silica gel/hexane-EtOAc) gave 4b
(185 mg) in 95% yield IR (neat) 3063, 1703 (C=O), 1179, 1050 cm-1; 1H NMR
(400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.87 (dd, J=19.5 Hz, 12.4 Hz, 1H), 7.17-7.23 (m, 4H),
7.30-7.37 (m, 5H), 7.47 (t, J=7.5 Hz, 1H), 7.62 (t, J= 7.3 Hz, 1H), 7.97
(d, J= 8.0 Hz, 2H); 19F NMR (376 MHz, CDCl3) δ -97.51 (dd, 2JF-F=279.1
Hz, 3JF-H=12.6 Hz, 1F), -104.11 (dd, 2JF-F = 279.4 Hz, 3JF-H = 19.4 Hz,
1F); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 56.9 (t, 2JC-F=22.8 Hz), 117.7 (t, 1JC-F
= 261.1 Hz), 128.5 (2C), 128.5 (2C), 128.6 (2C), 129.1 (2C), 129.7 (2C),
129.8 (t, 3JC-F=2.9 Hz), 131.6, 132.6 (t, 3JC-F= 2.2 Hz), 134.0 (d,
4JC-F=1.9 Hz), 134.2, 134.5 (2C), 134.5, 189.2 (t, 2JC-F =29.7 Hz); HRMS
(EI) calcd for C21H15ClF2OS 388.0500, found 388.0500.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General method B, for preparation of
heterocyclic alcohols (9-13): The N-heterocyclic alcohol (1 mmol) is
dissolved in 3 ml C6H6; CF3SO3H (3ml, 33mmol) is added slowly with
stirring. The reaction mixture stirred for overnight at 60°C and then the
reaction mixture poured on ice. More CHCl3 (ca. 30 ml) is then added and
the aqueous layer is mare basic with 10M NaOH. Separation of the organic
phase is followed by washings with water, and then twice with saturated
brine. The organic solution is dried with MgSO4, filtered, and
concentrated with rotary evaporator. If necessary, the product may be
further purified by silica gel chromatography (hexane: ethyl acetate).
2,2'-(biphenyl-4-ylmethylene)dipyridine (9).
2-(biphenyl-4-yl(pyridin-2-yl)methyl)-1-methyl-1H-benzo[d]imidazole (12).
Using general method B, compound 12 is isolated as a yellow oil (Rf 0.2,
2:1 hexanes: ethyl acetate):1H NMR (300 MHz, CDCl3) δ 3.71 (s, 3H), 6.05
(s, 1H), 7.22-7.48 (m, 10H), 7.57-7.61 (m, 4H), 7.67-7.70 (m, 1H),
7.82-7.85 (m, 1H), 8.60-8.62 (m, 1H). 13C NMR: δ 30.3, 52.6, 109.1,
120.1, 121.8, 122.2, 122.5, 124.2, 127.1, 127.4, 127.6, 128.8, 129.3,
136.0, 137.0, 138.0, 140.3, 140.6, 142.6, 149.3, 154.4, 160.0. Low
resolution MS (TOF-MS), 376 (MH+), 238, 133. High resolution MS (EI),
calculated for C26H22N3 376.1814, found 376.1806.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of 3a. To a stirred yellow toluene solution (30 mL) of 2a (1.53
g, 2.33 mmol) was added chlorotrimethylsilane (2.53 g, 23.3 mmol)
dropwise. The solution was stirred overnight. An orange precipitate
gradually formed. The reaction mixture was taken to dryness to obtain an
orange powder, which was collected on a frit, washed with pentane (3 x 5
mL), and dried. X-ray-quality orange crystals of 3a were grown by the
slow evaporation of a benzene solution of the compound. Yield 1.42 g,
2.22 mmol, 95%. 1H NMR (C6D6, 400 MHz): δ 7.58 (dd, 2H, JHP = 8 Hz, JHH =
8 Hz, o-PPh), 7.16 (t, 2H, 8 Hz, m-PPh), 7.06 (t, 1H, 8 Hz, p-PPh), 6.96
(m, 6H), 2.64 (m, 2H), 2.48 (s, 6H, ArCH3), 2.50 (m, 2H), 2.43 (s, 6H,
ArCH3), 1.91 (m, 2H), 1.78 (m, 2H), 1.69 (m, 4H). 31P{1H} NMR (C6D6, 162
MHz): δ 31.9 (s). 13C{1H} NMR (C6D6, 101 MHz): δ 172.4 (d, 51 Hz), 143.5,
135.8 (d, 35 Hz), 130.7 (d, 15 Hz), 129.7, 129.4, 129.2, 129.1, 128.7,
128.4, 127.4, 103.6 (d, 53 Hz), 32.5 (d, 18 Hz), 30.6 (d, 5 Hz), 24.0 (d,
9 Hz), 19.7, 19.0. EI-MS (m/z): 640 ([M]+), 532 ([M - PPh]+). Anal. Calcd
for C32H35Cl2N2PZr • 0.73 toluene: C, 62.93; H, 5.82; N, 3.96. Found: C,
62.58; H, 5.79; N, 3.88.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM New Cyclopentenyl-Linked [NPN] Ligands and Their Coordination Chemistry
with Zirconium: Synthesis of a Dinuclear Side-On-Bound Dinitrogen Complex
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Zhu, Ting; Wambach, Truman C.; Fryzuk, Michael D.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Inorganic Chemistry (2011), 50(21), 11212-11221

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reaction of Quinoline and Isoquinoline
Aldehydes with Arenes; General Procedure. The heterocyclic aldehyde (0.2
g) was dissolved in benzene (1 mL) or the corresponding arene (1 mL, for
19 and 20) and CF3SO3H (2 mL) and the mixture was stirred at r.t. for 3
h. The mixture was then poured over ice and the resulting solution was
made basic by slow addition of aq 50% NaOH solution. The products were
then extracted into CHCl3, the organic phase was washed with H2O then
brine, dried (MgSO4), and the product was isolated by removal of solvent
from under vacuum. 3-(Diphenylmethyl)quinoline, yield 95%. Mp 123-126 °C.
1H NMR (CDCl3/TMS): δ = 5.76 (s, 1 H), 7.17 (m, 4 H), 7.24-7.38 (m, 6 H),
7.51 (m, 1 H), 7.65-7.72 (m, 3 H), 8.09 (d, 1 H, J = 8.4 Hz), 8.79 (d, 4
H, J = 2.1 Hz,). 13C NMR (CDCl3/TMS): δ = 54.4, 126.7, 126.8, 127.7,
127.8, 128.6, 129.1, 129.2, 129.4, 135.3, 136.9, 142.5, 146.8, 152.5.
EI-MS: m/z = 295 (M+). Anal. calcd for C22H17N: C, 89.46; H, 5.80. Found:
C, 89.58; H, 5.89.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

arenes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

Manuel

$DATUM Synthesis (2000), (8), 1117-1120

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM From 1a at 2-fold excess of benzene: To a solution of 1a prepared from 1
(30.0 mg, 49.0 μmol, 1 equiv Ru) in 0.5 mL of CH3CN was added 3 mL of
H2O, 2 mL of DMF, and benzene (15.3 μL, 0.196 mmol, 2 equiv). The vessel
was sealed under nitrogen and the solution was reacted overnight (ca. 85
°C). The solution was cooled and the solvent removed under reduced
pressure. The resulting solid was dissolved in minimal H2O and
subsequently precipitated with an aqueous solution of NH4PF6, resulting
in [2a][PF6] as a white powder (44.3 mg, 95% yield). white powder [2a]Cl:
13C NMR (D2O, CH3OH, 75.5 MHz): δ 98.78, 97.57, 95.40, 87.75, 10.40,
10.10. ESI-MS: (102Ru) 331.1 (C16H21ORu requires 331.1). Anal. Calcd (%)
for C16H21ClORu: C, 52.53; H, 5.79. Found: C, 52.26; H, 5.72.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical experimental procedure for preparative
scale. 2 (Table 3, entry 1). Ethyl cinnamate (246 mg, 1.50 mmol, 1.0
equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.), Pd(OAc)2 (16.8 mg, 0.05 equiv.),
3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05 equiv.), tert-butyl peroxybenzoate
(285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid (7.0 mL) were combined in a 20 mL
scintillation vial equipped with a magnetic stir bar. The vial was sealed
with a Teflon-lined cap. The reaction was stirred at 100°C for 6 h. The
resulting reaction mixture was diluted with ethyl acetate (15 mL) and
quenched with a 10% aqueous Na2SO3 solution (20 mL). The organic layer
was separated and washed with 10% aqueous Na2SO3 solution (2 x 20 mL),
saturated aqueous NaHCO3 solution (3 x 20 mL), and brine (1 x 20 mL). The
organic layer was dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under
reduced pressure. The product was purified by column chromatography on
silica gel. Some products were further purified by HPLC (6 mL/min, Waters
SunFire Prep Silica 5 µm). Ethyl 3,3-diphenylacrylate (Table 3, Entry 1)
The title compound was prepared via the standard procedure using ethyl
cinnamate (246 mg, 1.50 mmol, 1.0 equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.),
Pd(OAc)2 (16.8 mg, 0.05 equiv.), 3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05
equiv.), tert-butyl peroxybenzoate (285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid
(7.0 mL). Methyl 3,3-diphenylacrylate (Table 3, Entry 2) The title
compound was prepared via the standard procedure using methyl cinnamate
(243 mg, 1.50 mmol, 1.0 equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.), Pd(OAc)2
(16.8 mg, 0.05 equiv.), 3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05 equiv.),
tert-butyl peroxybenzoate (285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid (7.0 mL).
The product was obtained as a clear oil (269 mg, 75% yield). 1H and 13C
NMR spectral data of the isolated material matched the spectral data
reported in the literature for this compound.4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Pyridine Ligands as Promoters in PdII/0-Catalyzed C-H Olefination
Reactions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kubota, Asako; Emmert, Marion H.; Sanford, Melanie S.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(7), 1760-1763

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Procedure for the synthesis of isoflavones (4)
The corresponding 3-dimethylamino-1-(2-hydroxyphenyl) propenones (2,
0.5mmol) and iodine (1.0mmol) were added to the corresponding solvent
(40mL) in 50 mL quartz tubes. The reaction mixture was irradiated with a
mercury lamp (500 W), and the environment temperature was kept about 20
°C by means of a quartz glass internal cold finger. The mixture was
stirred for 6–20 h until the staring material disappeared (monitored by
TLC using EtOAc and petroleum ether = 1:5 as the mobile phase). After
finishing the reaction, the mixture was treated with 10% NaHSO3 to remove
excess iodine and washed with water, and then, the organic layer was
concentrated under reduced pressure to remove solvent. Then, the residue
was purified by flash chromatography on silica gel (petroleum ether and
ethyl acetate from volume ratio of 80:1 to 30:1). Desired product 4.
Isoflavone (4a). [1] 6-Fluoroisoflavone (4d). [1] Yield 95% (113.9 mg) as
a colorless solid. M.p. 193-195 °C; 1H NMR (300 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 8.59 (s,
1H), 7.79 (m, 3H), 7.60 (m, 2H), 7.51–7.36 (m, 3H); 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 175.5, 159.7 (d, 1 J=246 Hz), 153.2, 152.5, 137.2, 131.5, 128.9,
128.6, 125.8 (d, 3 J=7 Hz), 124.8, 121.9(d, 2 J=24 Hz), 120.2 (d, 3 J=7
Hz), 111.2 (d, 2 J=24 Hz); IR ν (cm-1) 3076, 1635, 1596, 1481, 1365,
1265, 1211, 1164, 1133,1098, 942, 878, 827, 735, 690, 614; HRMS (ESI+)
m/z calcd. for C15H9FNaO2 [M+Na]+: 263.0484, found: 263.0469.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM photochemical, mercury lamp (500W) used

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure.
2-Methylamino-1,1-diphenylethane (20). Methylaminoacetaldehyde dimethyl
acetal (12) (0.37 g, 3.11 mmol) was dissolved in 2.0 mL of benzene, and
3.0 mL of TfOH was slowly added. After 4 h of stirring, the mixture was
poured over ice and neutralized with NaOH. The product was then extracted
into CHCl3 and the organic phase washed with water and then brine, dried
with MgSO4, and concentrated in vacuo. PRODUCT 19h 1 H NMR (300 MHz,
CDCl3) δ: 1.60 (m, 2H), 3.33 (m, 2H), 4.00 (t, J = 7.5 Hz, 1H), 7.20-7.40
(m, 10H). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3) δ: 47.1, 55.2, 65.2, 126.8, 128.3,
128.9, 142.9. Mass Spectrum, (e.i.) m/z: 197 (M+), 165, 152
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Chemistry of Dicationic Electrophiles: Superacid-Catalyzed Reactions of
Amino Acetals

Yun; de Leon, Sarah

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure for the synthesis of
compounds 1b-21b and 22-25: To a mixture of aldehydes (1.0 equiv.) in
arene (3.0 mL) was added boron trifluoride etherate (1.2 eqiuv.). The
mixture was cooled to 0°C and then homoallyl alcohol (1.0 equiv) in aryl
compound (2.0 mL) was added drop by drop over 10 min. The temperature was
slowly brought to rt in 1h. The reaction mixture was stirred at rt for
specified time. The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC using
ethyl acetate and hexane as eluents. After completion of the reaction,
the product was extracted with ethyl acetate, washed with brine and
water. The organic layer was dried (Na2SO4) and evaporated to leave the
crude product, which was purified by short column chromatography over
silica gel to give the title compounds.
2-(4-Fluoro-phenyl)-4-phenyl-tetrahydro-pyran (4b): Liquid, 95% yield 1H
NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 1.72 (q, J = 12.0 Hz,1 H), 1.80-1.93 (m, 2 H),
2.04 (dquint, J = 13.2 and 2.0 Hz, 1 H), 2.95 (tt, J = 11.6 and 4.4 Hz, 1
H), 3.75 (dt, J = 11.6 and 3.6 Hz, 1 H), 4.27 (ddd, J = 11.6, 4.4 and 2.4
Hz, 1 H), 4.45 (dd, J = 9.2 and 2.0 Hz, 1 H), 6.99-7.05 (m, 2 H),
7.19-7.25 (m, 3 H), 7.29-7.37 (m, 4 H). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 33.2,
41.5, 41.9, 68.4, 79.0, 115.0 (d, J = 20.6 Hz), 126.4, 126.7, 127.3 (d, J
= 7.6 Hz), 128.5, 138.8, 145.3, 162.2 (d, J = 243 Hz). 19F NMR (376 MHz,
CDCl3/C6F6): δ 46.44-46.51 (m, 1 F). IR: 3062, 3029, 2918, 2846, 1604,
1509, 1374, 1252, 1223, 1157, 1128, 1086, 833, 777, 758, 700 cm-1 . Anal.
Calcd for C17H17FO: C, 79.66; H, 6.69. Found: C, 79.59; H, 6.72.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM [0216] Step E: To an ice-cold mixture of the lactam (20.3 g, 100 mmol)
from step D above and benzene (80 mL) was added trifluoromethanesulfonic
acid (100 mL). The reaction mixture was warmed to room temperature and
stirred for 3 hours. The reddish-brown mixture was then poured into
ice-water mixture, and stirred until the ice melted. The product was
extracted into dichloromethane (4×), and the combined organic extracts
were washed with saturated sodium bicarbonate and brine, dried over
magnesium sulfate, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure. The
crude product was dissolved in ethyl acetate and filtered through a plug
of silica gel. The silica gel was washed with ethyl acetate to give the
aryl lactam (26.8 g, 95%) as a white foam. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ
7.28-7.25 (m, 2H), 7.22-7.18 (m, 1H), 7.08-7.06 (m, 2H), 6.86 (d, J=8.6
Hz, 1H), 6.71 (dd, J=8.5, 2.7 Hz, 1H), 6.66 (d, J=2.7 Hz, 1H), 5.02 (d,
J=16.1 Hz, 1H), 4.46 (dd, J=11.3, 5.2 Hz, 1H), 4.10 (d, J=16.1 Hz, 1H),
3.79 (s, 3H), 3.25 (dd, J=13.4, 11.5 Hz, 1H), 3.04 (s, 3H), 2.95 (dd,
J=13.4, 5.2 Hz, 1H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 5-Chloro-1-phenylpentanone-1 (IIa). Anhydrous
aluminum trichloride (17.3 g, 0.13 mol) was added by small portions under
stirring for 25 min to a cooled to 0°C solution of 5-chloropentanoate
chloride (18.6 g, 0.12 mol) (Ia) in absolute benzene (30 ml). The
resulting solution was stirred for 1 h at 0°C and then for 1 h at 20°C
and then poured out onto ice (200 g). The organic layer was separated,
and the aqueous layer was extracted with benzene (2 × 30 ml). The
extracts were combined, dried with anhydrous sodium sulfate, and the
solvent was evaporated and distilled in a vacuum.
7-Chloro-1-phenylheptanone-1 (IIb) was synthesized similar to (IIa) from
7-chloroheptanoate chloride (Ib) (33.7 g, 0.18 mol). Yield 38.5 g (95%).
bp 152-154 ° C/4 mmHg. Mass: m/z 224.7 [M+]. Calc. M 224.7 (C13H17ClO).
1H NMR (CDCl3): 1.25-1.61 (8 H, m, CH2CH2CH2CH2 CH2Cl); 2.92 (2 H, t,
J7.16, COCH2); 3.488 (2 H, t, J6.52, CH2Cl); 7.40 (2 H, m, m-H, Ph); 7.50
(1 H, t, J7.5, p-H, Ph); 7.91 (2 H, d, J 7.2, o-H, Ph). 13C NMR (CDCl3):
23.89 (CH2CH2CO); 26.53 (CH2CH2CH2Cl); 28.36 (CH2 CH2Cl); 32.24
(CH2CH2CH2 CH2Cl); 38.15 (COCH2); 44.78 (CH2Cl); [127.83 (2 C); 128.38 (2
C); 132.71; 136.91] (C6H5), 199.98 (CO). Published data [9]: bp
147-148°C/1.5 mmHg.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7646-78-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 144-55-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Ethyl
3-(4-Chlorophenylthio)-2,2-difluoro-3-phenylpropanoate (4aa). Under N2
atmosphere, SnCl4 (195 mg, 0.75 mmol) was added at room temperature to a
mixture of 3a (149 mg, 0.50 mmol) and benzene (1 mL). After stirring at
room temperature for 15 h, the mixture was poured into water (10 mL),
neutralized with aq NaHCO3, and extracted with Et2O (20 mL x 3). The
combined organic layer was dried over MgSO4 and concentrated under
reduced pressure. Purification by column chromatography (silica
gel/hexane-EtOAc) gave 4aa (164 mg) in 92% yield Ethyl
4-(4-Chlorophenylthio)-2,2,3,3-tetrafluoro-4-phenylbutanoate (4ca). The
reaction was performed as above using 3c (550 mg, 1.58 mmol), benzene (5
mL), and SnCl4 (625 mg, 2.40 mmol) at room temperature for 15 h.
Purification by column chromatography (silica gel/hexane-EtOAc) gave 4ca
(609 mg) in 95% yield IR (neat) 2986, 1773 (C=O), 1316, 1095 cm-1; 1H
NMR(400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 1.32 (t, J=7.2 Hz, 3H), 4.27 (q, J= 7.2 Hz, 2H),
4.57 (dd, J= 19.0, 12.4 Hz, 1H), 7.20-7.33 (m, 9H); 19F NMR (376 MHz,
CDCl3) δ -109.09 (dd, 2JF-F = 274.0 Hz, 3JF-H = 12.6 Hz, 1F), -114.31
(dd, 2JF-F = 274.1 Hz, 3JF-H=19.0 Hz, 1F), -117.45 (d, 2JF-F=277.7 Hz,
1F), -118.28(d, 2JF-F = 277.7 Hz, 1F); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 13.5,
55.5 (t, 2JC-F = 23.0 Hz), 63.8, 106.3-119.2 (m, 2C), 128.4 (2C), 128.7
(2C), 129.1 (2C), 129.39, 131.1, 133.4 (d, 3JC-F = 3.8 Hz), 134.8, 135.0
(2C), 159.9 (t, 2JC-F = 30.2 Hz); HRMS (EI) calcd for C18H15ClF4O2S
406.0417, found 406.0418.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Procedure of Cross-Coupling Reaction for
Separating Products. A 25 mL Schlenk tube was charged with
1,10-phenanthroline (45 mg, 0.25 mmol), KOt-Bu (225 mg, 2.0 mmol),
benzene or pyridine (5 mL), and aryl halides (0.5 mmol) in glovebox. Then
the tube was removed from the glovebox, and the resulting mixture was
stirred upon visible light irradiation (providing 400 mW cm-2 visible
light) for 24 h. The reaction was quenched with water in excess and the
residue was extracted with copious ethyl acetate. The combined organic
phase was concentrated under vacuum. The crude product was purified by
semipreparative HPLC (60% MeCN, 0.1% TFA) to give desired product.
Semipreparative HPLC was performed using an ODS column (ODS-A, 10 × 250
mm, 5 μm) at 5 mL/min. 1H NMR and 13C NMR were recorded on a BRUKER
BIOSPIN AVANCE III spectrometer using TMS as the internal standard.
4-Cyanobiphenyl (3h)[6] 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 7.43 (t, J = 7.5 Hz,
1H), 7.49 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 2H), 7.59-7.61 (m, 2H), 7.68-7.74 (m, 4H). 13C
NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ = 110.9, 119.0, 127.3, 127.5, 127.7, 128.8,
129.2, 132.6, 139.1, 145.6.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM photochemical, alternative preparation shown, Schlenk flask used,
glovebox used, alternative reaction conditions shown, UV light used (320
nm)
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Visible Light Photoredox Catalyzed Biaryl Synthesis Using Nitrogen
Heterocycles as Promoter
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Xu, Zhen; Gao, Li; Wang, Lele; Gong, Meiwei; Wang, Wenfeng; Yuan, Rusheng
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM ACS Catalysis (2015), 5(1), 45-50

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reactions of alcohols 1-7, 16: The alcohol (1
mmol) is dissolved in 1mL of C6H6 and 3 mL of CF3SO3H is added. After at
least 2 hrs of stirring, the mixture is poured over ice, and the solution
is made basic with 10 M NaOH. Extraction with CHCl3 is followed by
aqueous washes of H2O (1x) and brine (2x), and then drying with anhydrous
Na2SO4. The product is then purified by chromatography (hexane : EtOAc)
or recrystallization. Diethyl-(2-methyl-3,3-diphenyl-propyl)-amine (10).
Oil. 1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ, ppm: 1.0-1.03(m, 9H), 2.10-2.14(m, 1H),
2.33-2.36(m, 1H), 2.42-2.46(m, 2H), 2.60-2.66(m, 3H), 3.64(d, J = 10.2Hz,
1H), 7.20-7.24(m, 2H), 7.32-7.40(m, 8H). 13C NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ, ppm:
11.8, 17.8, 35.6, 47.5, 57.6, 58.4, 76.9, 77.1, 77.4, 126.1, 128.0,
128.4, 128.5, 144.4, 144.7. HRMS calcd for C20H27N: 281.2144. Measured:
281.2146.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis of [(η6-C6H6)RuH(CO)(PCy3)]+BF4- (2). In a glove box, complex 1
(200 mg, 0.12 mmol) was dissolved in benzene (10 mL) in a 25 mL Schlenk
tube equipped with a Teflon screw-cap stopcock and a magnetic stirring
bar. The tube was brought out of the box, and HBF4·OEt2 (64 μL, 0.48
mmol) was added via syringe under N2 stream. The color of the solution
was changed from dark red to pale yellow immediately. After stirring for
1 h at room temperature, the solvent was removed under vacuum, and the
residue was crashed by adding hexanes (10 mL). Filtering the resulting
solid through a fritted funnel and recrystallization from CH2Cl2/hexanes
yielded the product as a pale yellow powder (262 mg, 95% yield). Single
crystals of 2 suitable for Xray crystallography were obtained from a slow
evaporation of benzene and hexanes solution. For 2: 1H NMR (CD2Cl2, 400
MHz) δ 6.53 (s, C6H6), 2.0-1.2 (m, PCy3), -10.39 (d, JPH = 25.9 Hz,
Ru-H); 13C{1H} NMR (CD2Cl2, 100 MHz), δ 196.4 (d, JCP = 19.3 Hz, CO),
100.0 (C6H6), 38.4, 38.2, 30.2, 29.9, 27.4, 27.3 and 26.2 (PCy3); 31P{1H}
NMR (CD2Cl2, 162 MHz) δ 72.9 (PCy3); IR (KBr) νCO = 1991 cm-1; Anal.
Calcd for C25H40BF4OPRu: C, 52.18; H, 7.01. Found: C, 51.73; H, 6.91.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Intermolecular Dehydrative Coupling Reaction of Aryl Ketones with Cyclic
Alkenes Catalyzed by a Well-Defined Cationic Ruthenium-Hydride Complex: A
Novel Ketone Olefination Method via Vinyl C-H Bond Activation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Yi, Chae S.; Lee, Do W.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organometallics (2010), 29(8), 1883-1885

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME399 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 3-Bromo-1-phenylbutan-2-one [29412-73-5].2 Benzene (100 mL), Rh2(O2CCF3)
(10 mg, 0.015 mmol), and anhydrous K2CO3 (5.00 g, 14.0 mmol) were added
to a 250-mL round-bottom flask, and the resulting solution was stirred at
room temperature for 5 min. Then, a solution of
3-bromo-1-diazobutan-2-one (1.24 g, 7.0 mmol) in benzene (50 mL) was
added dropwise over 30 min via syringe pump. The resulting reaction
mixture was stirred at room temperature for 2 h, and then it was
concentrated by rotary evaporation. The residue was purified by flash
chromatography on silica gel (eluted with 10→30% CH2Cl2 in hexanes),
which afforded the desired product as a yellow oil (1.79 g, 95% yield).
1H NMR (CDCl3, 500 MHz) δ 7.34 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 2H), 7.30 (t, J = 7.0 Hz,
1H), 7.25 (d, J = 7.0 Hz, 2H), 4.50 (q, J = 7.0 Hz, 1H), 4.04 (d, J =
15.5 Hz, 1H), 3.99 (d, J = 15.5 Hz, 1H), 1.72 (d, J = 7.0 Hz, 3H).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Ethyl 2-hydroxy-2-phenylacetate (33a): General Procedure for
Friedel-Crafts Alkylation of Moderately Nucleophilic Arenes (B): In a
flame-dried 3-mL screw cap vial with a stir bar, ethyl glyoxylate (32)
(100 mg, 0.98 mmol) was charged under N2. The vial was then charged with
2 mL of solvent (CH2Cl2, toluene, or benzene) and the arene (if
different). Tin (IV) chloride (115 microL, 1.0 mmol) was then added at
room temperature, and the reaction was monitored by TLC. Upon completion,
the reaction was poured into 30 mL of a 1:1 mixture of CH2Cl2 and water.
The layers were separated and the aqueous layer was extracted with 2 x 20
mL of CH2Cl2. The organic layers were combined, washed with brine, dried
over MgSO4, and concentrated in vacuo. The title compound was prepared
according to General Procedure B. The reaction was conducted with benzene
as the solvent and the arene nucleophile. Upon addition of all reagents,
the reaction was heated to 60 degC for 6 hr. Following flash column
chromatography on SiO2 gel using 20 % Et2O/petroleum ether as the eluent,
170 mg (95 % yield) of the title compound was isolated as a colorless
oil.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Alkylation of benzene with 1-(adamantan-1-yl)-1,2,3,6-tetrahydropyridines
2a-e (General method). Trifluoromethanesulfonic acid (10 ml, 11.3 mmol)
was added portionwise with stirring to a solution of
1,2,3,6-tetrahydropyridine 2a-e (5 mmol) in benzene (10 ml), while
cooling the reaction mixture on an ice bath. After stirring for 30 h at
25°C, the reaction mixture was poured on ice, adjusted with 30% NaOH to
pH 10-11, and extracted with dichloromethane (3×15 ml). The combined
organic extracts were dried over anhydrous Na2SO4 and evaporated at
reduced pressure. The products 4a-c were purified by recrystallization
from a 15:1 mixture of hexane and ethyl acetate.
1-(Adamantan-1-yl)-4eq-phenylpiperidine (4a). Yield 1.4 g (94%),
colorless needles. mp 111-113°C. IR spectrum, v, cm-1: 3442, 2910 (C-H
Ad), 2848 (C-H Ad), 1598, 1494, 1452, 1311, 1097, 1018, 950, 821, 750,
698. 1H NMR spectrum, δ, ppm (J, Hz): 1.58-1.70 (6H, m, 3CH2 Ad);
1.72-1.91 (10H, m, 3CH2 Ad, 3,5-CH2); 2.10 (3H, br. s, 3CH Ad); 2.22-2.32
(2H, t, 3 J = 11.4, 2,6-CHax); 2.46 (1H, tt, 3 J = 3.9, 3 J = 12.1,
4-CHax); 3.27 (2H, d, 3 J = 11.9, 2,6-CHeq); 7.15-7.19 (1H, m, H-4 Ph);
7.22-7.30 (4H, m, H-2,3,5,6 Ph). 13C NMR spectrum, δ, ppm: 29.8 (CH Ad);
34.4 (3,5-CH2); 37.0 (CH2 Ad); 38.5 (CH2 Ad); 43.4 (4-CH); 45.1
(2,6-CH2); 54.6 (C Ad); 126.0 (C-4 Ph); 127.0 (C-2,6 Ph); 128.4 (C-3,5
Ph); 146.7 (C-1 Ph). Mass spectrum, m/z (I rel, %): 295 [M]+ (40), 238
(100), 201 (6), 135 [Ad]+ (100), 91 (8). Found, %: C 85.29; H 9.95; N
4.81. C21H29N. Calculated, %: C 85.37; H 9.89; N 4.74.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Arylation Procedure . To a microwave
vial equipped with a stir bar was added Pd(OAc)2 (5.4 mg, 5 mol %), and
Ag2CO3 (71 mg, 0.51 equiv). The aryl halide was weighed into a separate
vial (0.5 mmol, 1 equiv). The halide was dissolved/mixed in ¼ the amount
of arene coupling partner and added to the reaction vessel via syringe.
The vial ws then rinsed 3x ¼ the volume of the arene to reach the total
reaction volume. The microwave vial was sealed with Teflon cap and
stirred at 125 °C for 16 h. Upon cooling, the reaction was filtered
through a silica plug (1:1 Et2O:hexanes). The combined solution was
concentrated and the crude mixture was purified via column chromatography
to afford the biphenyl products. Biphenyl-2-yl(phenyl)methanone (2e) The
title compound 2e was prepared according to the general procedure
described above using (2-bromophenyl)(phenyl)methanone 1e with benzene
(100 equiv), and purified by column chromatography (10% Et2O in hexanes)
as a clear oil (122.0 mg, 94%). Rf = 0.41 (10% Et2O in hexanes). The
observed characterization data (1H) was consistent with that previously
reported in the literature.6 Rf = 0.41 (10% Et2O in hexanes). 1H NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.71-7.68 (m, 2H), 7.61 (td, J = 7.4, 1.5 Hz, 1H),
7.57-7.47 (m, 3H), 7.46-7.41 (m, 1H), 7.32-7.28 (m, 4H), 7.25-7.16 (m,
3H). LRMS Calcd for C19H14O M+: 258.31 Found: 258.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Umpolung Direct Arylation Reactions: Facile Process Requiring Only
Catalytic Palladium and Substoichiometric Amount of Silver Salts
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Mousseau, James J.; Vallee, Frederic; Lorion, Melanie M.; Charette, Andre
B.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of the American Chemical Society (2010), 132(41), 14412-14414

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical experimental procedure for preparative
scale. 2 (Table 3, entry 1). Ethyl cinnamate (246 mg, 1.50 mmol, 1.0
equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.), Pd(OAc)2 (16.8 mg, 0.05 equiv.),
3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05 equiv.), tert-butyl peroxybenzoate
(285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid (7.0 mL) were combined in a 20 mL
scintillation vial equipped with a magnetic stir bar. The vial was sealed
with a Teflon-lined cap. The reaction was stirred at 100°C for 6 h. The
resulting reaction mixture was diluted with ethyl acetate (15 mL) and
quenched with a 10% aqueous Na2SO3 solution (20 mL). The organic layer
was separated and washed with 10% aqueous Na2SO3 solution (2 x 20 mL),
saturated aqueous NaHCO3 solution (3 x 20 mL), and brine (1 x 20 mL). The
organic layer was dried over MgSO4, filtered, and concentrated under
reduced pressure. The product was purified by column chromatography on
silica gel. Some products were further purified by HPLC (6 mL/min, Waters
SunFire Prep Silica 5 µm). Ethyl 3,3-diphenylacrylate (Table 3, Entry 1)
The title compound was prepared via the standard procedure using ethyl
cinnamate (246 mg, 1.50 mmol, 1.0 equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.),
Pd(OAc)2 (16.8 mg, 0.05 equiv.), 3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05
equiv.), tert-butyl peroxybenzoate (285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid
(7.0 mL). trans-Ethyl cinnamate (Table 3, Entry 3) The title compound was
prepared via the standard procedure using ethyl acrylate (164 µL, 1.50
mmol, 1 equiv.), benzene (1.5 mL, 11.2 equiv.), Pd(OAc)2 (16.8 mg, 0.05
equiv.), 3,5-dichloropyridine (11.1 mg, 0.05 equiv.), tert-butyl
peroxybenzoate (285 µL, 1.0 equiv.), and acetic acid (7.0 mL). The
product was obtained as a clear oil (164 mg, 62% yield). 1H and 13C NMR
spectral data of the isolated material matched the spectral data reported
in the literature for this compound.5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective, Fujiwara-Moritani reaction, sealed vial used
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM Kubota, Asako; Emmert, Marion H.; Sanford, Melanie S.

$DATUM Organic Letters (2012), 14(7), 1760-1763

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reaction of Quinoline and Isoquinoline
Aldehydes with Arenes; General Procedure. The heterocyclic aldehyde (0.2
g) was dissolved in benzene (1 mL) or the corresponding arene (1 mL, for
19 and 20) and CF3SO3H (2 mL) and the mixture was stirred at r.t. for 3
h. The mixture was then poured over ice and the resulting solution was
made basic by slow addition of aq 50% NaOH solution. The products were
then extracted into CHCl3, the organic phase was washed with H2O then
brine, dried (MgSO4), and the product was isolated by removal of solvent
from under vacuum. 2-(Diphenylmethyl)-8-hydroxyquinoline, yield 94%. Mp
250-254 °C. 1H NMR (CDCl3/TMS):: δ = 5.85 (s, 1 H), 7.13 (m, 1 H),
7.19-7.34 (m, 12 H), 7.40 (m, 1 H), 8.06 (d, 1 H, J = 8.4 Hz). 13C NMR
(CDCl3/TMS): δ = 59.5, 110.0, 117.5, 123.0, 126.7, 126.9, 127.4, 128.5,
129.4, 136.5, 137.5, 142.3, 152.0, 160.8. EI-MS: m/z = 311 (M+). Anal.
calcd for C22H17NO: C, 84.86, H, 5.50. Found: C, 83.84, H, 5.65.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM The superacid induced condensation of quinolinecarboxaldehydes with
arenes

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2000), (8), 1117-1120

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Reaction of 1-Acetylisoquinoline. A 0.2 g (1.2

were isolated by column chromatography (9:1 hexanes/ether).
4-(1,1-Diphenylpropyl)pyridine, yield 94%. mp 41-44 °C (CHCl3); 1H NMR δ

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Procedure for the Arylation of Alkynes:
Approximately 0.2 g of alkyne (ca. 1 mmol) is dissolved in 1 mL C6H6 and
4 mL of triflic acid is added (NOTE: if the amino-alkyne is used as a HCl
or HBr salt, the reaction vessel should be equipped with a vent to
release HCl or HBr gas). The mixture is stirred for 6 hrs and poured over
about 15 g of ice. The resulting mixture is made basic with 50% NaOH and
extracted twice with CHCl3. The organic extracts are washed with water,
then brine, and dried over MgSO4. Concentration with reduced pressure
then gives the products; if necessary, column chromatography is done over
silica. 3-(1,1-diphenylethyl)pyridine (18):
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, Friedel-Crafts-type reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Reactive Dications: The Superacid-Catalyzed Reactions of Alkynes Bearing
Adjacent N-Heterocycles or Amine Groups
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Klumpp, Douglas A.; Rendy, Rendy; Zhang, Yun; McElrea, Aaron; Gomez,
Alma; Dang, Han
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Organic Chemistry (2004), 69(23), 8108-8110

$DATUM Os[BCl(NC5H4NMe)]Cl(CO)(PPh3)2 (8). A solution of Os-(BCl2)Cl(CO)(PPh3)2
(170 mg, 0.198 mmol) in benzene (12 mL) was added to
2-(methylamino)pyridine (200 mg, 185 mmol) to produce a bright yellow
precipitate. After it was stirred for 15 min, the mixture was
concentrated in vacuo to ca. 3 mL and EtOH was added. Pure 8 was
collected by filtration as a yellow solid and washed with EtOH and hexane
(yield 172 mg, 94%). Anal. Calcd for C43H37BCl2N2OOsP2 ·C6H6: C, 58.28;
H, 4.29; N, 2.77. Found: C, 58.30; H, 4.27; N, 2.89.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Reaction of Os(BCl2)Cl(CO)(PPh3)2 with 2-Aminopyridine

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2.1.3. Synthesis of 2-benzylbenzonitriles 1 by
the Friedel–Crafts reaction: A typical procedure for synthesis of
2-benzyl-1-naphthonitrile 1n To a flask charged with AlCl3 (0.989 g, 7.42
mmol) in dry benzene (9.3 mL) was added 2-(bromomethyl)-1-naphthonitrile
10n (0.911 g, 3.70 mmol) in an ice bath. The reaction mixture was warmed
to room temperature and then heated to reflux for 45 min. When all the
starting materials were consumed, as checked by TLC, the reaction mixture
was cooled to room temperature, poured into ice and then acidified with 1
N HCl. The organic materials were extracted with CH2Cl2. The combined
organic extracts were washed with water and then with brine and dried
over anhydrous MgSO4. The solvents were removed in vacuo and the
resulting crude material was subjected to flash column chromatography
(hexane : EtOAc = 90 : 10). 2-benzyl-1-naphthonitrile 1n (0.711 g, 2.92
mmol) in 79% yield. 2,6-dibenzylbenzonitrile (1q) 94% yield from 10q;
Pink Solid. mp. 74.3-75.3 °C; IR (NaCl) 3086, 3065, 2926, 2220, 1495,
1466, 1454 cm-1; 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.21 (4H, s), 7.09 (2H, d, J =
8.0 Hz), 7.20-7.25 (6H, m), 7.29-7.34 (4H, m), 7.37 (1H, t, J = 8.0 Hz);
13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 40.5, 112.8, 117.3, 126.7, 127.7, 128.7,
129.0, 132.5, 138.8, 125.5; ESIHRMS: Found: m/z 284.1443. Calcd for
C21H18N: (M+H)+ 284.1439.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES

$DATUM Preparative Scale Exchange Experiment. In a 100-mL flask equipped with a
magnetic stirring bar was put η6-fluorobenzene((2-
methylthiopyrrolyl)dipyrrolylphosphine) dicarbonylchromiu m(0) (50a, 114
mg, 0.240 mmol), and the flask was placed under argon. Then 20 mL of
freshly distilled benzene was added and the solution was heated to 60 °C
for 3 h. The resulting yellow solution was cooled to room temperature,
filtered through Celite, and the filtrate was concentrated on a rotary
evaporator to yield yellow solid that was chromatographed on silica gel
(hex:EtOAc 10:1) to yield η6-benzene(2-
(methylthiopyrrolyl)dipyrrolylphosphine) dicarbonylchromium(0) (44a) (100
mg, 94% yield, pure by 1H NMR). η6-benzene(2-
(methylthiopyrrolyl)dipyrrolylphosphine) dicarbonylchromium(0) (44a), 100
mg, 94% yield

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedures for the BF3-H2O catalyzed
reactions of trifluoroacetaldehyde methyl hemiacetal and
difluoroacetaldehyde ethyl hemiacetal 3a and 3b with arenes The
trifluoroacetaldehyde methyl hemiacetal 2a, 80% (w/w in H2O), (0.3 g,
1.85 mmol) was mixed with excess of arene (10 mmol) in a pressure tube.
The mixture was cooled to 0 °C and BF3-H2O (5 g, 58 mmol) was added
slowly. For difluorobenzene and nitrobenzene 7 g and 10 g of BF3-H2O were
used, respectively. The mixture was stirred for the required period of
time (Table 1) at room temperature or higher, depending on the nature of
the substrate. nature of the substrate. Similar results were obtained
when reactions were carried out in triflic acid (34 mmol) for comparison
(Table 2). The progress of all reactions was monitored by TLC (4:1
hexane/ethyl acetate) and GC-MS. After completion of the reactions, the
mixtures were poured over ice ( ≈ 25g), neutralized with sodium
bicarbonate and extracted with CH2Cl2 (3 x 15 mL). The organic extracts
were combined, washed with water and dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. The
solvent was removed by vacuum evaporation and crude products were
purified with column chromatography on silica gel (70-230 mesh) using
hexane/ethyl acetate as eluent. The products were characterized by
spectral analysis (NMR, GC-MS and HRMS).
1,1,1-Trifluoro-2,2-diphenylethane (3a)16a, 23, yield 94%. 1H NMR (400
MHz, CDCl3): δ 4.66 (q, J(H-F) = 10.07 Hz, 1H), 7.24-7.36 (m, 10H); 13C
NMR (100.5 MHz, CDCl3): δ 55.53 (q, 2J(C-F) = 27.47 Hz), 126.23 (q,
1J(C-F) = 280.00 Hz), 128.23, 129.03, 129.42, 135.41; 19F NMR (376 MHz,
CDCl3): δ -66.26 (d, J(H-F) = 9.92 Hz); GC-MS (EI ), m/z, 236.7 (M+).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM slow addition of triflic acid, Friedel-Crafts reaction, no solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Fluoroanalogs of DDT: Superacidic BF3-H2O Catalyzed Facile Synthesis of
1,1,1-Trifluoro-2,2-diarylethanes and 1,1-Difluoro-2,2-diarylethanes
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 4072-28-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-091-CAS-2024283
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 94
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1493-13-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Diaryl Ketone Synthesis, General Procedure.
Trifluoromethanesulfonic acid (0.35 mL, 4 mmol) was added to a solution
of amide 17 (0.24 g, 1 mmol) and the arene (1 mmol) in anhydrous CH2Cl2
(2 mL). The mixture was stirred for 3 h at 50 °C and then poured over
ice. The products were extracted into CHCl3, and the organic solution was
washed with H2O (2×) and brine (2×) and dried over anhydrous sodium
sulfate. The crude product was isolated and purified via column
chromatography (hexane/ethyl acetate). Note: ketones 19 and 22 were
prepared using the corresponding arene as solvent. Yield 94%. Compound
20.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Friedel-Crafts acylation
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Friedel-Crafts acylation with amides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DATUM 67-66-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Preparation of Aryl-Substituted Oxyindoles (6,
15-21, and 33) and Compounds 27-32 and 37. The R-ketoamide (1 mmol) with
the arene nucleophile (i.e., 1 mL of C6H6) was dissolved in CHCl3 (5 mL),
and CF3SO3H (2 mL, 23 mmol) was slowly added. The resulting solution was
stirred overnight (ca. 18 h) at 50 °C. The mixture was then poured over
ca. 15 g of ice and extracted twice with CHCl3. The organic phase was
then washed once with water andtwice with brine and dried over anhydrous
Na2SO4. If necessary, the product was further purified by column
chromatography (hexane/ether).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM superacidic conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Superacid-Promoted Reactions of α-Keto amides and Related Systems
